pullRequest.title: Added unit tests for the rca.net package
pullRequest.bodyText:
Issue #, if available: 51
Description of changes:

Added unit tests for the rca.net package
Added ability to check if NetServer is running
Moved CompositeSubscribeRequest to its own subpackage, and ignored that subpackage from Jacoco coverage
Added various getters and setters to main classes
Added a NodeDetails constructor which is incredibly useful for testing
Added a RejectingExecutor() test class, which is an executor that throws a RejectedExecutionException for all requests (useful for testing)
Added the WaitFor utility class. This class currently allows you to wait up to N seconds (or whatever time unit) for some condition to evaluate to true.

Tests:

Increased branch coverage of NodeStateManagerTest
Covered the drainAll() method in ReceivedFlowUnitStoreTest
Added the SubscribeResponseHandlerTest, SubscriptionManagerTest, WireHopperTest classes

Code coverage percentage for this patch: 99%
By submitting this pull request, I confirm that my contribution is made under the terms of the Apache 2.0 license.

nodes.bodyText: Can someone comment on this behavior? Should we always terminate remote connections for passed host parameters regardless of whether the subscription manager is aware of the given graphNode?

nodes.bodyText:
If this is only for tests, can we check for the requestNode and destinationNode strings explicitly instead of overriding the equals methods ?
Otherwise in Java, with equals(), hashcode() needs to be implemented as well

nodes.bodyText: Can I suggest an alternative ? Can we add a prehook and post hook which will be empty and then for test we override these methods to set the variable and we can test it ? I assume this variable is only for test purposes only ?
If this is for test only, can we annotate it as such ?
we can probably avoid this copy here, right ? Although the test is the only one that needs it, the release code also pays the price for it.
Should we make all the arguments final ?
This is good but I see that it's being used by test classes (and very rightly so). So, should we move it to the test packing instead of keeping it here ?
We are missing a newline at the end of the file ?
Why do we always name as uut ? :)
I don't quite understand what we are testing here. We should test for some expected value or else this test will always pass.
Is there a reason all these have to be static ?

How did we arrive at this number ? I have seen arbitrary sleeps make test cases flaky. And sometimes the tests take too long to run because there are multiple tests doing this. It might be a good idea to check for the expected value in a loop for some max timeouts where the sleeps between each iteration is in milliseconds. That way we don't wait more than we have to. and the timeout can be much longer than 3 seconds as we expect to break out of them early anyways
